intro: Humbertacalia coursii, commonly known as the Coursii's humbertacalia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed margins, and its stems are covered in soft, woolly hairs. Humbertacalia coursii is adapted to thrive in arid and rocky environments, often found in limestone soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
